html.p: The easiest way to become a contributor is to checkout the source code from the CVS Repository, do some work and send the patches in. If you are interested in continuing to help, you can get write access to CVS which will make it easier to help.

You probably also want to sign up to the contributor Mailing List, which is also where patches should be sent. If you want to help, but are unsure where to start, the mailing list is a good place to ask questions and make suggestions.

I'm not overwhelmingly fussy about coding styles (I get enough of that sort of thing at work). Also, NewsAgent's source is shockingly inconsistent in things like brace positioning. Just follow "common sense" guidelines, like using comments sensibly, not using hard tab characters and using UNIX eol characters.
Before checking in code, make sure it builds. Information on building NewsAgent and other Dubh projects can be found in the DevTools project.
Use the mailing lists and frequently let us all know what you're up to. This makes it easier for everyone to help out and avoid stepping on each others toes.
I'm still looking for a servlet based bug database to use for Dubh.Org. If you have any suggestions, please mail me.
